channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Do you have some bad habits? Good news - you can make new ones. Here's how
item.description: Research shows it helps to start small if you want new habits to stick. NPR's Life Kit has more.
item.content:encoded: Research shows it helps to start small if you want new habits to stick. NPR's Life Kit has more.
item.dc:creator: Marielle Segarra

item.title: The physics of the spiral pass have long been a mystery. Not anymore
item.description: The physics of the spiral pass have baffled physicists and football fans for decades.
item.content:encoded: The physics of the spiral pass have baffled physicists and football fans for decades.
item.dc:creator: Kai McNamee

item.title: We're talking to you - Taxi Driver is 50
item.dc:creator: Emily Kwong

item.title: How one New Hampshire town made sure its water was 'Safe to Drink'
item.description: NPR's Emily Kwong talks with Mara Hoplamazian about the new podcast, "Safe to Drink," about Merrimack, New Hampshire's fight for clean drinking water.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Emily Kwong talks with Mara Hoplamazian about the new podcast, "Safe to Drink," about Merrimack, New Hampshire's fight for clean drinking water.
item.dc:creator: Mallory Yu

item.title: Breezy Johnson wins gold, while Lindsey Vonn crash ends comeback quest
item.description: On the first Sunday of the Olympic Winter Games, downhill skier Breezy Johnson captured the first gold for Team USA. And alpine racer Lindsay Vonn crashed and was transported to the hospital with a broken leg.
item.content:encoded: On the first Sunday of the Olympic Winter Games, downhill skier Breezy Johnson captured the first gold for Team USA. And alpine racer Lindsay Vonn crashed and was transported to the hospital with a broken leg.
item.dc:creator: Emily Kwong

item.title: U.S.-India trade deal improves relations, but strain still shows
item.description: After months of wrangling and much tension, India and the US have finally released a framework for an interim trade agreement
item.content:encoded: After months of wrangling and much tension, India and the US have finally released a framework for an interim trade agreement
item.dc:creator: Diaa Hadid

item.title: The seismometers at the end of the earth have names
item.description: Scientists have placed two seismometers 8000 feet below the ice cap at the South Pole to measure earthquakes and support tsunami alerts.
item.content:encoded: Scientists have placed two seismometers 8000 feet below the ice cap at the South Pole to measure earthquakes and support tsunami alerts.
item.dc:creator: Kai McNamee

item.title: Investigating one of the worst train accidents in Spain's history
item.description: More than a week after one of the worst train accidents in Spain's history, many questions remain unanswered, and survivors struggle to move on.
item.content:encoded: More than a week after one of the worst train accidents in Spain's history, many questions remain unanswered, and survivors struggle to move on.
item.dc:creator: Miguel Macias

item.title: What does it mean when the president calls to "nationalize the voting"?
item.description: Wendy Weiser, the vice president for democracy at the Brennan Center for Justice, discusses the impact of President Trump's recent urging of Republicans to "nationalize" voting.
item.content:encoded: Wendy Weiser, the vice president for democracy at the Brennan Center for Justice, discusses the impact of President Trump's recent urging of Republicans to "nationalize" voting.
item.dc:creator: Ahmad Damen

item.title: Temperature check by voters in Minnesota
item.description: In the first electoral temperature check in Minnesota since President Trump launched Operation Metro Surge to ramp up immigration enforcement in the state, voters had a lot to say.
item.content:encoded: In the first electoral temperature check in Minnesota since President Trump launched Operation Metro Surge to ramp up immigration enforcement in the state, voters had a lot to say.
item.dc:creator: Dana Ferguson
